Sample_treatment_protocol_ch1: The cells were treated with or without 5mM metformin (D150959, Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO).
Sample_growth_protocol_ch1: The lung cancer cell line H1299 (ATCC, CRL-5803) was obtained from the American Type Culture Collection (ATCC). The cells were cultured in RPMI 1640 medium (Lonza, Allendale, NJ) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS), 100 U/mL penicillin, and 100 μg/mL streptomycin, at 37°C in a humidified atmosphere with 5% CO2.
Sample_extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated from cultured H1299 cells using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA LT Sample Prep Kit (Illumina, San Diego, CA). DNA contamination was removed using DNase, and the remaining RNA was broken into short fragments. The RNA fragments were reverse transcribed into cDNA, ligated with adaptors, and PCR amplified. The amplified cDNAs were then selected by a range of sizes and sequenced using a next-generation sequencing device (NovaSeq 6000 System)., The sequence library was mapped to the reference genome UCSC hg19 using the Bowtie2 program.
Sample_data_processing: After sequencing, the low-quality reads and PCR duplicates were removed by Trimmomatic 0.38., The trimmed sequences were then assembled into reference transcripts using the HISAT2 program., The read count was normalized into a value of FPKM (Fragments Per Kilobase of transcript per Million mapped reads), and the reads with a value of zero were excluded., Significantly up- or down-regulated genes were identified by cutoff value of |FC| >
cell type: Non-small cell lung cancer cell line
Supplementary_files_format_and_content: *.gene_abund.anno.tab: Tab-delimited text files include FPKM and TPM values.

Sample_treatment_protocol_ch1: The cells were treated with or without 5mM metformin (D150959, Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO).
Sample_growth_protocol_ch1: The lung cancer cell line H1299 (ATCC, CRL-5803) was obtained from the American Type Culture Collection (ATCC). The cells were cultured in RPMI 1640 medium (Lonza, Allendale, NJ) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS), 100 U/mL penicillin, and 100 μg/mL streptomycin, at 37°C in a humidified atmosphere with 5% CO2.
Sample_extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated from cultured H1299 cells using the TruSeq Stranded mRNA LT Sample Prep Kit (Illumina, San Diego, CA). DNA contamination was removed using DNase, and the remaining RNA was broken into short fragments. The RNA fragments were reverse transcribed into cDNA, ligated with adaptors, and PCR amplified. The amplified cDNAs were then selected by a range of sizes and sequenced using a next-generation sequencing device (NovaSeq 6000 System)., The sequence library was mapped to the reference genome UCSC hg19 using the Bowtie2 program.
Sample_data_processing: After sequencing, the low-quality reads and PCR duplicates were removed by Trimmomatic 0.38., The trimmed sequences were then assembled into reference transcripts using the HISAT2 program., The read count was normalized into a value of FPKM (Fragments Per Kilobase of transcript per Million mapped reads), and the reads with a value of zero were excluded., Significantly up- or down-regulated genes were identified by cutoff value of |FC| >
cell type: Non-small cell lung cancer cell line
Supplementary_files_format_and_content: *.gene_abund.anno.tab: Tab-delimited text files include FPKM and TPM values.

Sample_treatment_protocol_ch1: The cells were treated with or without 5mM metformin (D150959, Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO).
Sample_growth_protocol_ch1: The lung cancer cell line H1299 (ATCC, CRL-5803) was obtained from the American Type Culture Collection (ATCC). The cells were cultured in RPMI 1640 medium (Lonza, Allendale, NJ) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS), 100 U/mL penicillin, and 100 μg/mL streptomycin, at 37°C in a humidified atmosphere with 5% CO2.
Sample_extract_protocol_ch1: Chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP) was performed with the SimpleChIP Enzymatic Chromatin IP Kit (Magnetic Beads) (#9003, Cell Signaling Technology, Danvers, MA) according to the manufacturer's instructions. Briefly, cells were cross‐linked with 1% formaldehyde (Sigma‐Aldrich) and lysed. Chromatin was digested with micrococcal nuclease into 150-900bp DNA/protein fragments. The fragments were immunoprecipitated with antibodies against H3K4me3 (C42D8, Cell Signaling Technology), H3K27me3 (C36B11, Cell Signaling Technology), or normal rabbit IgG with protein G magnetic beads. Cross-links were reversed, and purified DNAs were then subjected to next-generation sequencing (NovaSeq 6000 System).
Sample_data_processing: Raw data was checked by FastqQC program and trimmed with the Trimmomatic 0.38., The sequence library was mapped to the reference genome UCSC hg19 using the Bowtie1 program., Peaks were identified using the MACS2 algorithm., Regions with p-value < 0.001 (-log10 p-value greater than 3) were considered statistically significant.
cell type: Non-small cell lung cancer cell line
